title: Measuring the Ocean
caption: The Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI) has hundreds of instruments collecting data every minute of every day from locations (arrays) throughout the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. Here we are looking at data from the Coastal Pioneer Array (red box).

title: Central Surface Mooring
caption: The Coastal Pioneer is located in the Mid-Atlantic off the coast of Rhode Island and Massachusetts. Data in this activity were collected from the Central Surface Mooring.

title: Mooring Diagram
caption: The Surface Buoy (red box) at the Central Surface Mooring location contains the instruments used to collect these data. Data for this activity were collected using bulk meteorology and surface wave spectra instruments.

title: Surface Mooring
caption: This is a picture of the Surface Buoy in the water.  The wind sensors are the little claw-like objects sticking out at the top. The propellers in the middle of the picture are actually used to generate electricity to power the mooring.

title: Surface Mooring
caption: Wave height is the distance between the highest point (the crest) and the lowest point (the trough) of a single wave. Wave period is the amount of time that elapses between two successive waves
